author: Special Correspondent
text:
To mark Chief Minister’s birthday celebrations

As part of the ongoing 68th birthday celebrations of their party leader and Chief Minister Jayalalithaa, the youth wing of All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam functionaries here plans to conduct 68 types of sports events on Race Course Grounds and three other venues in the city on Monday.

The events include archery, arm wrestling, ball badminton, boxing, body building, cricket, chess, cycling, fencing, football, gymnastics, handball, athletic events, judo, kabaddi, karate, kho-kho, rope climbing, rifle shooting, swimming, table tennis, throw ball, power lifting, yoga and traditional games such as ‘golikundu’ ‘pambaram,’ ‘kittipullu,’ ‘pandi’ and ‘thaayam.’

Event coordinator Solai M. Raja and Deputy Mayor K. Thiraviam said that the unique event would be conducted in association with the respective recognised sports associations in the city. Prize money to the tune of Rs. 15 lakh would be distributed. Apart from Race Course Grounds, the Madura College ground and two other venues would be used for conducting the events, with the participation of 400 referees.

A torch, “Amma 68,” would be brought in a procession from AR Police Grounds to the Race Course at 6.30 a.m. and Cooperation Minister ‘Sellur’ K. Raju would inaugurate the events.

Apart from students, 320 differently abled persons and 30 transgenders have registered their names for the events, chief coordinator of the event R.K. Durai Singh said.

“The unique event would be conducted in association with the respective recognised sports associations”
title: AIADMK men plan 68 sports events
